item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1719 had a crack and released approximately one (1) gallon to the dock floor. R+L Carriers remediated the dock floor, then retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to perform a tote transfer. The crew transferred the tote and broke down the damaged tote for containerization in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report X-2025041814

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE WORLDPORT LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY FACILITY EIGHT AIR PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH AND WERE PRINTED PERISHABLE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING MEAT IN EACH BOX. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE ARE 1Z50RW850194515072, 1Z50RW850191732495, 1Z50RW850194655251, 1Z50RW850190194444, 1Z50RW850192831028, 1Z50RW850192746086 AND 1Z50RW850192625037. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM IOWA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 50RW85, PINE RIDGE FARMS, 1800 MAURY ST, DES MOINES IA 50317.

  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 20:40 PM ET, Alyssa Estes with NMO contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Montgomery, AL. The spill consists of approximately half a gallon of Sure Klean 600, which released from 1-1-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift puncture during dock operations. The spill has impacted the dock floor only. The call center will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup as this is a corrosive release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately (1) 5-gallon jug of UN3264 Sure Klean 600 product released to dock floor due to forklift puncture. The contractors used absorbents to dry up the spill and sprayed with soda ash solution to neutralize it. The impacted pallet was wrapped and was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails in a paper box due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the pails and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040643
item.description:
Report E-2025040643

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: DONALSONVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 04/16/2025, at 19:19 hours, CSX personnel, reported train M64515 transporting car FURX 894276 (Load, Crude Zinc Oxide) was leaking a white material from a hole in the bottom of the hopper car. The reported location was mile post AN 753.00 on the Dothan subdivision, near the Fox Lane crossing, in Donalsonville, GA. The initial cause of the release was damage to the hopper body which has resulted from mechanical failure of the car's truck assembly. Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSX emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the incident. Upon arrival, contractor personnel confirmed two wheel burns to the hopper body which resulted in product spillage. Contractor personnel patched the holes, and the car was held pending unloading or movement under OTMA.

item.title: Report E-2025040639
item.description:
Report E-2025040639

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. The paint dried so Dayton Freight personnel did not need to deploy granular absorbents to the impacted area. They gathered the damaged pail and containerized it into one (1) 8-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
